author: arnetheduck
content: agree that setting the endpoint to an explicit url provides some balance as it now becomes obvious where the data is going, instead of being hidden in the client code - this is certainly an improvement - it also decreases the probability of successful exploits of the kind where by accident, people run clients that contact a hard-coded web site after for example a dns hijack (say in countries with aggressive firewalls or even a registry lapse caused by human error)
